intro: Acinodendron aegrotans, commonly known as the fever tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, lowland areas and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. The fever tree is also notable for its historical use in traditional medicine.
